entry.title: First Mover Asia: Lido DAO Governance Token Down, Staked Ether Stable as Withdrawal Proposal Comes Into Focus; Bitcoin Rises as Fed Rate Decision Nears
entry.summary: While the DAO has yet to formally see the proposal to allow withdrawals from stETH, Galaxy Digital has already been critical, and the Lido governance token has fallen about 15% from its high last week week.

entry.title: Bitcoin's Upswing Is Reminiscent of 2019 Bull Revival
entry.summary: The action four years ago coincided with the Fed taking its foot off the tightening pedal. Bitcoin has rallied almost 40% in January and the Fed plans slower rate increases in coming months.

entry.title: Index Coop Introduces Index for Diversified Liquid Ethereum Staking
entry.summary: Interest in liquid staking protocols such as these has been on the rise so far this year ahead of Ethereum's Shangai upgrade set to take place in March.

entry.title: Solana Liquid-Staking Tool Marinade Looks to Bolster Its Token Value With Staked SOL Capture
entry.summary: Pseudonymous Marinade developer Cerba said the effort will bring more legitimacy to mSOL, which is ahead of Lidoâ€™s Solana LSD token despite that big-name protocolâ€™s dominance on Ethereum.

entry.title: Maple Finance Plots Comeback With New $100M Liquidity Pool for Tax Receivables With 10% Yield
entry.summary: After defaults and a major overhaul, crypto lending protocol Maple Finance moves away from uncollateralized lending toward bringing yield-generating real-world assets to crypto investors.

entry.title: Binance Introduces Function for API Users to Prevent Self-Trading
entry.summary: The service will be available to Binance's API users from Jan. 26. Users of the exchange's website and app will not be affected.

entry.title: SEC Derailed Circle's Plans to Go Public via SPAC Deal: Report
entry.summary: Circle, the company behind stablecoin USDC, has said its $9bn plans to go public didn't go through because the Securities & Exchange Commission (SEC) did not sign off on it.

entry.title: First Hearing in Genesis Bankruptcy Case Set For Monday
entry.summary: Genesis' first hearing in its bankruptcy case is set for January 23.

entry.title: Genesisâ€™ Crypto Trading Arm Is Moving Money Around, a Sign of Normalcy Amid Siblingâ€™s Bankruptcy
entry.summary: About $125 million was sent to exchanges in the run-up to Genesisâ€™ lending division filing for Chapter 11, and more was moved the next day.

entry.title: U.S. Lays Claim to $700 Million of Assets Linked to Bankman-Fried, FTX
entry.summary: The U.S. seized $700 million of former FTX CEO Sam Bankman-Friedâ€™s assets and is now seeking their forfeiture.

entry.title: Crypto Markets Today: Bitcoin Surges Above $22K, Genesis Has Over $5B in Liabilities
entry.summary: Bitcoin rose 6% to trade at $22,300. Ether was also trading up, by 5% to $1,640. Equities closed up.

entry.title: Binance Garnered Largest Market Share of Crypto Investors From Emerging Markets in 2022
entry.summary: A CryptoCompare report found that as inflation surged worldwide, the crypto exchange giant attracted the largest number of retail investors from countries facing high inflation.

entry.title: Stellar Foundation Nicked by Genesis Bankruptcy With $13M Claim
entry.summary: The Stellar Development Foundation was revealed to be among the bankrupt crypto lending deskâ€™s largest creditors.

entry.title: Bitcoin Miner 1Thash Sent Almost All Its BTC to Binance
entry.summary: On-chain data sourced from CryptoQuant shows that the 5,592 BTC worth some $124 million that was transferred out of the minerâ€™s address in the past three days ended up in Binance.

entry.title: Bitcoin Soars Over $22K to Reach Four-Month High
entry.summary: Bitcoin rose over 5% and reached its highest level since mid-September. Market watchers will be eyeing the Federal Reserveâ€™s next utterances.

entry.title: Moodyâ€™s Further Downgrades Coinbase Junk Bonds, Joining S&P
entry.summary: The ratings agency cited Coinbaseâ€™s weakened revenue and cash flow generation potential due to the ongoing crypto winter as reasons for the move.

entry.title: What's Next for Genesis Creditors? It Depends on What's in the Bankruptcy Filing
entry.summary: Eric Snyder, partner at Wilk Auslander LLP, says that a substantial amount of haircuts are likely to be made, but that depends on the petition Genesisâ€™ trio of companies filed.

entry.summary: Itâ€™s the latest case to emerge from Avraham Eisenbergâ€™s â€œhighly profitable trading strategy.â€

entry.title: Bad Vibes from the Word 'Crypto' Have Some Calling for a Rebrand
entry.summary: Money-making associations with cryptocurrencies misrepresent them as just currencies and fail to acknowledge the diverse applications of the technology.

entry.title: Alameda-backed Moonstone Bank Making a â€˜Return to Its Rootsâ€™
entry.summary: Moonstoneâ€™s assets were on the rise as an SBF entity poured in millions

entry.title: Sullivan & Cromwell Gets Go-Ahead to Represent FTX in Bankruptcy Proceedings, Despite Controversy
entry.summary: James Bromley, a partner at Sullivan & Cromwell, said former CEO Sam Bankman-Fried has been stirring the pot by â€œlashing outâ€ on Twitter.

entry.title: Genesis Claims $5.1B in Liabilities in First-Day Bankruptcy Filing
entry.summary: Three of the institutional crypto brokerage's entities filed for Chapter 11 protection late Thursday.

entry.title: Latest in Crypto Hiring: Another Ex-BlockFi Exec Resurfaces in New Role
entry.summary: ConsenSys among latest firms bit by layoffs amid â€œvery challenging macroeconomic environmentâ€

entry.title: Fairfax County, Virginia, Pension Funds Exposed to Genesis Bankruptcy
entry.summary: Two Washington, DC-area pensions invested $35 million in a VanEck fund listed as a Genesis creditor.

entry.title: Crypto Trading Firm Cumberland DRW Disputes Genesis Exposure
entry.summary: The Chicago-based firm was listed among Genesis' creditors in the amount of $18 million, but Cumberland said that's too high. The document includes "misleading and incorrect information," Cumberland tweeted.

entry.title: Crypto Lender Genesis Is FTX's Largest Unsecured Creditor With $226M in Claims
entry.summary: Genesis Global Capital leads the revised list that un-redacted the names of several creditors.

entry.title: Crypto Analysts Warn Against Shorting DYDX Ahead of $200M Token Unlock
entry.summary: The unlock, which takes place on Feb. 2, will release 150 million coins worth $202 million and 15% of the total supply.

entry.title: Ex-FTX.US Head Raises $5M for Startup Months After Exchange's Collapse
entry.summary: Investors included the venture arms of Coinbase and Circle, a former FTX portfolio company.

entry.title: Digital Currency Group Owes Subsidiary Genesis Global Over $1.65B
entry.summary: The crypto finance firm filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy yesterday, with debts around $3.5 billion.

entry.title: Fantom Blockchain to Fund Ecosystem Projects Using Portion of Burnt FTM Fees
entry.summary: The fund is aimed at empowering builders on Fantom by offering a decentralized avenue for funding projects, ideas, and creations through a community-driven decision process.

entry.title: Objectors to FTX Using Sullivan & Cromwell as Its Law Firm Seek to Delay Court Hearing
entry.summary: Individual objectors have sought to delay an FTX hearing in the United States Bankruptcy Court in the district of Delaware scheduled at 10:00 a.m. EST on January 20, 2023 expected to be about whether FTX can retain the services of New York law firm Sullivan & Cromwell (S&C) amid allegations from the U.S. Trustee claiming potential conflicts of interest.

entry.title: Craig Wrightâ€™s Blacklist Resembles Bitcoin â€˜Kill Switchâ€™ Satoshi Never Followed Through On
entry.summary: The blacklist manager was unveiled last October and is part of Bitcoin SVâ€™s digital asset recovery process.

entry.summary: Crypto exchange FTX has recovered more than $5 billion in different assets, not including another $425 million in crypto held by the Securities Commission of the Bahamas, a bankruptcy attorney said during a hearing Wednesday.

entry.title: Coinbase Rally May Be a Selling Opportunity, Says Bank of America
entry.summary: Analyst Jason Kupferberg downgraded the crypto exchange to underperform from neutral, saying 2023 estimates are still too high.

entry.title: BNB Flips USDC, Cardano Flips Dogecoin With Crypto Relief Rally
entry.summary: Binanceâ€™s BNB has benefitted as crypto looks to recover from a dismal quarter, now usurping USDC on leaderboards

entry.title: Binance Wins Seventh Approval in Europe, Registers With Swedish Regulator
entry.summary: Bnance has registered with Sweden's Financial Supervisory Authority, making the Nordic country the seventh European jurisdiction in which the crypto exchange has been granted approval.

entry.title: Five UK Associations Form Crypto Alliance to Steer Digital Asset Regulation
entry.summary: The U.K. Forum for Digital Currencies, which includes governing body City of London Corporation, also aims to further the countries crypto hub ambitions.

entry.title: First Mover Americas: CME BTC Futures Signal Worst of FTX-Induced Panic May Be Over
entry.summary: The latest price moves in bitcoin (BTC) and crypto markets in context for Jan. 10, 2023. First Mover is CoinDeskâ€™s daily newsletter that contextualizes the latest actions in the crypto markets.

entry.title: Gala Games Deletes Tweet Announcing Partnership With Hollywood Star The Rock; Native Token Drops
entry.summary: Crypto followers on Twitter consider selling GALA token after Gala Games deleted a tweet announcing partnership with A-list Hollywood stars without offering an explanation.

entry.title: Crypto Exchange Zipmex Faces Probe From Thai Securities Regulator: Bloomberg
entry.summary: The regulator is investigating if Zipmex was operating as a digital asset fund manager without permission.

entry.title: Hong Kong to Propose Approved Set of Crypto Tokens for Retail Trading: Reuters
entry.summary: Hong Kong's Securities and Futures Commission (SFC) will allow retail trading in a select group of cryptocurrencies as it attempts to turn the city into a crypto hub.
